gurmukhi: jYsy qau krq suq Aink ieAwnpn qaU n jnnI Aqugn auir DwirE hY
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Karat Sout Anik Iaanapana , Taoo N Jananee Atougan Uri Dhaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as a mother ignores many of her son's amateurish deeds and brings him up with love and care.

gurmukhi: jYsy qau srin sUir pUrn prqigAw rwKY Aink AvigAw kIey mwir n ibfwirE hY
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Sarani Soori Pooran Paratagiaa Raakhai , Anik Avagiaa Keeay Maari N Bidaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as a warrior abides by his woe/pledge in respect of one who comes in his refuge and despite his showing disrespect does not kill him.

gurmukhi: jYsy qau sirqw jlu kwstih n borq krq icq lwj ApnoeI pRiqpwirE hY
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Saritaa Jalu Kaasatahi N Borata , Karat Chit Laaj Apanoee Pratipaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as a log of wood does not sink in river, since it carries a latent respect that he (river) has helped the tree grow by providing it with life-giving water.

gurmukhi: qYsy hI prm gur pwrs prs giq isKn ko ikrqu krmu kCU nw ibcwirE hY ]379]
transliteration: Taisay Hee Param Gur Paaras Paras Gati , Sikhan Ko Kiratu Karamu Kachhoo Naa Bichaariao Hai ?379?
translation: So is the great benefactor True Guru who like a philosopher stone is capable of turning the Sikhs into gold-like metal. He does not dwell on their erstwhile deeds and by blessing them with Naam Simran, make them virtuous like Himself.  (379)
